channel.title: Error - Run
channel.description:
I'm using this 317 PI and I am getting this error on the start up.
[code=java][11/13/11 6:21 PM]: New Legacy is now online. [11/13/11 6:21 PM]: Exception in thread "main" [11/13/11 6:21 PM]: java.net.Bind Exception: Address already in use: bind [11/13/11 6:21 PM]: at sun.nio.ch.Net.bind(Native Method) [11/13/11 6:21 PM]: at sun.nio.ch.ServerSocketChannelImpl.bind(ServerSocketC hannelImpl.java:119) [11/13/11 6:21 PM]: at sun.nio.ch.ServerSocketAdaptor.bind(ServerSocketAdapt or.java:59) [11/13/11 6:21 PM]: at org.apache.mina.transport.socket.nio.SocketAcceptor.r egisterNew(SocketAcceptor.java:363) [11/13/11 6:21 PM]: at org.apache.mina.transport.socket.nio.SocketAcceptor.a ccess$800(SocketAcceptor.java:55) [11/13/11 6:21 PM]: at org.apache.mina.transport.socket.nio.SocketAcceptor$W orker.run(SocketAcceptor.java:222) [11/13/11 6:21 PM]: at org.apache.mina.util.NamePreservingRunnable.run(NameP reservingRunnable.java:51) [11/13/11 6:21 PM]: at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:662) Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
Thanks, really need help.

item.title: Error - Run
item.dc:creator: @New_Legacy New Legacy
item.description:
@New_Legacy wrote:

I don’t have another server running.

Read full topic

item.title: Error - Run
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“The Wanderer, post:6, topic:421496”][quote author=tyb97 link=topic=524159.msg3814149#msg3814149 date=1321175069]

Where in your server are you calling the bind method?

:fp:
He already has the server running.

Well my bad for not being as smart as you.
[/quote]
If you don’t know what the error means, you should always google. That’s how you figure out those “odd” java errors. There’s always documentation on them. Only reason I got mad was because you were telling him how to fix something you didn’t know what you were talking about. Sorry if I came off angry also, just tired.[/quote]
It’s no problem, I have had this issue before to, just didn’t notice it at first.

Read full topic

Where in your server are you calling the bind method?

:fp:
He already has the server running.
[/quote]
Well my bad for not being as smart as you.[/quote]
If you don’t know what the error means, you should always google. That’s how you figure out those “odd” java errors. There’s always documentation on them. Only reason I got mad was because you were telling him how to fix something you didn’t know what you were talking about. Sorry if I came off angry also, just tired.

item.description:

I’m using this 317 PI and I am getting this error on the start up.

[11/13/11 6:21 PM]: New Legacy is now online. [11/13/11 6:21 PM]: Exception in thread "main" [11/13/11 6:21 PM]: java.net.Bind Exception: Address already in use: bind [11/13/11 6:21 PM]: at sun.nio.ch.Net.bind(Native Method) [11/13/11 6:21 PM]: at sun.nio.ch.ServerSocketChannelImpl.bind(ServerSocketC hannelImpl.java:119) [11/13/11 6:21 PM]: at sun.nio.ch.ServerSocketAdaptor.bind(ServerSocketAdapt or.java:59) [11/13/11 6:21 PM]: at org.apache.mina.transport.socket.nio.SocketAcceptor.r egisterNew(SocketAcceptor.java:363) [11/13/11 6:21 PM]: at org.apache.mina.transport.socket.nio.SocketAcceptor.a ccess$800(SocketAcceptor.java:55) [11/13/11 6:21 PM]: at org.apache.mina.transport.socket.nio.SocketAcceptor$W orker.run(SocketAcceptor.java:222) [11/13/11 6:21 PM]: at org.apache.mina.util.NamePreservingRunnable.run(NameP reservingRunnable.java:51) [11/13/11 6:21 PM]: at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:662) Press any key to continue . . .
